content: in 2020 a couple named mr v and mrs s decided to get a divorce by mutual consent they made agreements regarding the division of their property custody of their children and financial matters they agreed on the distribution of assets including a vehicle and financial accounts as well as the division of debts including a mortgage and car financing they also made arrangements for the custody and residence of their children including visitation rights and expenses they waived any claims for spousal maintenance the divorce proceedings will be filed in a family court and the costs will be borne by mrs s the document also mentions their application for a judicial reorganization or collective debt settlement the notary confirmed their identity and marital status and informed them of their rights the parties granted power of attorney to handle tax matters related to the deed they requested the notary to send them the deed via email the parties acknowledged that they have read the full deed and are aware of the relevant laws in 2020 mrs s approved the cancellation of a document that was deemed void a certified copy was made and registered with the notary the document was then dispatched and registered with the office of legal certainty a mortgage story was also registered with the office of the registrar and the registration fees were paid the mortgage deed was notarized with a reference number the amount transcribed at the legal certainty office was €23000
